An **orcish cloak** is a type of [cloak](/wiki/Cloak "Cloak") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. It is made of [cloth](/wiki/Cloth "Cloth"), and appears as a **coarse mantelet** when [unidentified](/wiki/Identification "Identification").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 Description](#Description)

- [3 Strategy](#Strategy)

- [4 History](#History)

- [5 Variants](#Variants)

  - [5.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [5.2 UnNetHack](#UnNetHack)
  - [5.3 dNetHack](#dNetHack)
  - [5.4 EvilHack](#EvilHack)

- [6 References](#References)

## Generation

[Uruk-hai](/wiki/Uruk-hai "Uruk-hai") have a 1⁄3 chance of [generating with](/wiki/Monster_starting_inventory "Monster starting inventory") an orcish cloak;[\[1\]](#cite_note-1) [orc-captains](/wiki/Orc-captain "Orc-captain") have a 1⁄2 chance of being generated with Uruk-hai armor, giving them an effective 1⁄6 chance of generating with the cloak.[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)

## Description

When worn, an orcish cloak provides no base [AC](/wiki/AC "AC") before enchantment, but confers [MC](/wiki/MC "MC")1.

## Strategy

While most cloaks (minus the [dwarvish cloak](/wiki/Dwarvish_cloak "Dwarvish cloak")) are generally better than orcish cloaks, the cloak is sufficient enough to protect body armor from [erosion](/wiki/Erosion "Erosion") until a proper one is found. If you test unknown [scrolls](/wiki/Scroll "Scroll") by reading them, an orcish cloak can also be useful as a throwaway cloak to catch the [scroll of destroy armor](/wiki/Scroll_of_destroy_armor "Scroll of destroy armor"), after which you can put your regular cloak back on.

## History

The orcish cloak first appears in [NetHack 3.0.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.0 "NetHack 3.0.0"). From this version to [NetHack 3.4.3](/wiki/NetHack_3.4.3 "NetHack 3.4.3"), including soome variants based on these versions, a worn orcish cloak grants MC2.

## Variants

Variants based on NetHack 3.4.3 may retain the orcish cloak's MC2 when worn.

Some variants may give orcs (including the player) an AC bonus for wearing orcish cloaks.

### SLASH'EM

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), the orcish cloak grants MC2 when worn as in NetHack 3.4.3. An orcish cloak can be [upgraded](/wiki/Upgraded "Upgraded") into either an [oilskin cloak](/wiki/Oilskin_cloak "Oilskin cloak") or an [elven cloak](/wiki/Elven_cloak "Elven cloak"), with an equal chance for each item.

### UnNetHack

In [UnNetHack](/wiki/UnNetHack "UnNetHack"), orcish cloaks grant +1 AC to orcish monsters that wear them, including player [orcs](/wiki/Orc_\(starting_race\) "Orc (starting race)").

### dNetHack

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), an orcish cloak grants 0 AC, 0 [DR](/wiki/DR "DR") and MC2 when worn.

[The Mantle of Wrath](/wiki/The_Mantle_of_Wrath "The Mantle of Wrath") is an [artifact](/wiki/Artifact "Artifact") orcish cloak that can be safely enchanted to +7. While carried, it grants [fire resistance](/wiki/Fire_resistance "Fire resistance") and [aggravate monster](/wiki/Aggravate_monster "Aggravate monster"); while worn, it also confers [acid resistance](/wiki/Acid_resistance "Acid resistance") and [half spell damage](/wiki/Half_spell_damage "Half spell damage"), and blocks all sources of aggravate monster.

### EvilHack

In [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), orcish cloaks grant +1 AC to orcish monsters that wear them, including player orcs.

[Goblin outriders](/wiki/Goblin_outrider "Goblin outrider"), [goblin-captains](/wiki/Goblin-captain "Goblin-captain") and various [orcish](/wiki/Racial_monster "Racial monster") [mercenaries](/wiki/Mercenaries "Mercenaries") have a 1⁄3 chance of generating with an orcish cloak.

## References
